description: Borrowed from Latin nōmen (“name”). Doublet of name and noun.

entries.meaning: (historical) The name of a citizen of Ancient Rome, designating them as a member of a gens.
(historical) The birth name of a pharaoh, the fifth of the five names of the royal titulary, traditionally encircled by a cartouche and preceded by the title zꜣ-rꜥ.
